intro: Viguiera potosina, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer and early fall. Viguiera potosina is typically found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is gray-green and often has a fuzzy texture, making it an attractive addition to native gardens.
